Organs/Tissues: Generic human microvascular network + optional organ-specific cells
Physiological/Pathological: Primarily normal physiology (healthy microvasculature), can be used to study angiogenesis, vascular toxicity
Cell Source: Primary human endothelial cells (e.g. HUVEC) + pericytes/mesenchymal cells; can add parenchymal organ cells (optional)
Stromal Cells: Pericytes or mesenchymal stromal cells for vascular support; other organ stroma if added
Tissue-resident Immune: No (standard), can be added if needed
Circulating Immune: Possible to flow leukocytes in the vessel under perfusion
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Not typically; single micro-organ unit unless customized
Extracellular Matrix: 3D collagen or fibrin gel supporting vessel network
3D Scaffold: Yes, a 3D gel where vessels self-assemble and organ cells can be embedded
Notable Features: Self-assembled human microvasculature under continuous flow, used for vascular biology or toxicity
Plate/Format (Throughput): Custom microfluidic chips, low–medium throughput (~1–4 units/chip)
Max Culture Duration: Days to ~2 weeks for stable vascular networks
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, confocal imaging of 3D vessel formation in gel
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, can collect outflow for secreted factors or small molecules
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible at endpoint by digesting gel
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix/stain in-chip or carefully extract gel for histology
Readouts - TEER: No (3D vasculature, barrier measured by tracer leakage)
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in; rely on imaging or external assays
Perfused: Yes, continuous flow through the microvessels
Gas Mix Controlled: Standard incubator (5% CO₂, 37°C); O₂ set by environment
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow/dosing controlled externally; can add stimuli or immune cells on demand
model_availability: Service-based (CRO) with in-house platform; not sold as standalone kit

Organs/Tissues: 3D human tumor co-cultured with microvascular network
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological (cancer): evaluate tumor growth, vascular interactions, immuno-oncology
Cell Source: Human endothelial cells + pericytes + tumor cells (cell lines or patient-derived)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (tumor, endothelium, pericytes). Can add fibroblasts for TME
Stromal Cells: Yes, pericytes and possibly CAFs for tumor stroma
Tissue-resident Immune: Not standard; can incorporate if needed
Circulating Immune: Yes, can flow T-cells/CAR-T to model infiltration
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Within the tumor microenvironment + vasculature; not multi-organ linking
3D Scaffold: Yes, tumor spheroid or cells in 3D + capillaries
Notable Features: Perfused tumor microenvironment, allows drug delivery via vessels, immune cell extravasation
Max Culture Duration: Days to ~2 weeks, capturing tumor–vessel interactions
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, confocal imaging of tumor, vessels, immune infiltration
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, measure secreted factors or drug/metabolites in outflow
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, at endpoint by enzymatic gel digestion or partial dissection
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix/stain entire vascularized tumor for morphological/IF analyses
Readouts - TEER: No, use permeability or leakage for barrier function
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in sensors; rely on imaging/assays
Perfused: Yes, functional capillaries with flow mimicking blood supply
Real-time Microenvironment Control: User can vary flow, add drugs or immune cells, track real-time changes
model_availability: Service-based projects for oncology/immuno-oncology drug testing

Organs/Tissues: Human BBB model: brain microvascular endothelium + astrocytes + pericytes
Physiological/Pathological: Replicates healthy BBB with tight junctions, can test disruption or drug penetration
Cell Source: Primary human brain microvascular endothelial cells, astrocytes, pericytes
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (endothelium + astrocytes + pericytes). Immune not standard
Stromal Cells: Astrocytes/pericytes are essential glial/stromal for BBB
Tissue-resident Immune: Not by default (microglia can be added if needed)
Circulating Immune: Possible to flow immune cells in the vessel, but not typical
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No (single BBB model, though could be part of broader system in R&D)
Air-Liquid Interface: No (fully fluid environment on both sides of the barrier)
Extracellular Matrix: Collagen/fibrin or matrix supporting 3D arrangement, enabling tight junctions
3D Scaffold: Yes, a 3D neurovascular unit with embedded endothelium & glia
Notable Features: Functional BBB traits (tight junction proteins, efflux transporters), perfused vasculature
Max Culture Duration: Days to ~2 weeks, stable BBB phenotype
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, observe barrier integrity, fluorescent tracers crossing BBB, morphological changes
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, measure drug crossing or secreted factors in outflow
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible at endpoint, though more complex to dissect cell layers
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix/stain for tight junction markers, astrocyte markers
Readouts - TEER: Not integrated; barrier function measured by tracer permeability
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in; rely on external permeability assays
Perfused: Yes, flow simulating blood side, influences endothelium under shear
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow & drug dosing can be changed, can model inflammation or other disruptions
model_availability: Service-based for BBB penetration, neurotox assays

Organs/Tissues: Human bone marrow niche (hematopoietic stem cells + stroma) + functional microvessels
Physiological/Pathological: Models normal hematopoiesis, drug-induced neutropenia, can be used for BM toxicity
Cell Source: Human CD34+ hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells, marrow stromal cells, endothelial cells
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (HSCs, stromal, endothelium). Immune lineages produced (e.g. neutrophils)
Stromal Cells: Marrow mesenchymal/stromal cells for niche support
Tissue-resident Immune: Bone marrow progenitors + developing neutrophils, etc.
Circulating Immune: Cells can exit marrow into vascular channel, simulating bloodstream release
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No, single bone marrow environment with perfused vessel
Extracellular Matrix: Collagen/fibrin gel for BM niche + endothelial support
3D Scaffold: Yes, a 3D hematopoietic microenvironment with vascular bed
Notable Features: Demonstrates neutrophil production & egress, can predict neutropenia from chemo drugs
Max Culture Duration: Days to a few weeks for hematopoiesis; still in R&D
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, can visualize emerging neutrophils and vessel interactions
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, measure cytokines or track cells in outflow
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, can isolate released cells or dissect the niche at endpoint
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, can fix entire BM compartment for histology
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in, rely on imaging / external assays
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator environment, possibly varying O₂ for BM physiology
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow/dosing can be changed, add G-CSF or chemo to observe blood cell output changes
model_availability: Emerging service, funded by NIH SBIR; not fully commercial yet
